QuestionJSON.Question:
Ellis is calculating the changes in potential energy(PE) and kinetic energy (KE) of an object. They wrote the following program to calculate the potential energy (PE) and kinetic energy (KE) of the object, and the changes in PE and KE. What are the variables in this program?

double mass = 2; double velocity = 3; double height = 4; double PE = mass * gravity * height; double KE = 0.5 * mass * velocity * velocity; double deltaPE = newPE - PE; double deltaKE = newKE - KE;
QuestionJSON.Answer1: mass, velocity, height, PE, KE, deltaPE, deltaKE
QuestionJSON.Answer2: mass, velocity, height, gravity, newPE, newKE
QuestionJSON.Explanation: In the given program, mass, velocity, height, PE, KE, deltaPE, and deltaKE are the variables. They are assigned certain values and these values can be modified as the program progresses.
